name: .VOB File Extension
summary: Learn about .VOB files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: A VOB file is a video file from a DVD, typically stored in the VIDEO_TS folder at the root of the DVD along with .BUP and .IFO files. It contains most of the data stored on the disc, including video, audio, subtitles, DVD menus, and other navigation contents. VOB files are limited to 1 GB.

content: DVD Forum, an international organization comprising various companies, developed the VOB format. They based the format on the MPEG program stream format, and most files are formatted as MPEG-2 system streams.

Since most commercial DVDs use copyright protection, VOB files extracted from the DVD may be encrypted, which may result in an error when copying the file to another location. Several decrypting programs are available for playing the VOB file without the proper credentials. However, the programs may be illegal in certain countries.

instructions: You can open a VOB file with various media players, such as VideoLAN VLC media player, CyberLink PowerDVD, and MPlayerX. For example, to open a VOB file with VLC media player in Windows, select Media â†’ Open File....
Various media players and video editors, such as VideoLAN VLC media player, ShedWorx Smart Converter, and Roxio Toast, can convert VOB files to other formats.

You might want to do this if, for example, your VOB file contains music that you want to listen to via an audio player.
